main event: A circular object was observed in the sky over Sidney, Ohio, by three witnesses on 13 February 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared solid with visible color structure, yellow/white in color, and was travelling in a northerly direction., Witnesses described the object as moving in a predictable manner over a duration of about 20-30 minutes., The object initially looked bright like a planet and then started flashing red, blue, and green lights., The exact altitude of the object was estimated to be about 30-45 degrees above the horizon., Weather conditions were reported as cloudy with thick heavy clouds at the time of observation.
sighted object: circular object with visible color structure
witness description: A witness described the objectâ€™s appearance, lighting, and movement in a handwritten account.
